SEARCH
Package com.mimecast.robin.smtp

Class SmtpListener

java.lang.Object
com.mimecast.robin.smtp.SmtpListener
public class SmtpListener extends Object
SMTP socket listener for handling client connections.

This class runs a ServerSocket bound to a configured network interface and port.

For each accepted connection, it creates an EmailReceipt instance to handle the SMTP session.

It uses a ThreadPoolExecutor to manage concurrent connections efficiently.

See Also:
  • EmailReceipt
  • Server

  • Field Details

    • log

      private static final org.apache.logging.log4j.Logger log

    • listener

      private ServerSocket listener
      The underlying server socket that listens for incoming connections.

    • executor

      private final ThreadPoolExecutor executor
      Thread pool for handling client connections. Using a ThreadPoolExecutor allows for fine-tuning of thread management, which is crucial for performance and resource control.

    • serverShutdown

      private volatile boolean serverShutdown
      Flag to indicate a server shutdown is in progress. This is used to gracefully stop the connection acceptance loop.

    • port

      private final int port

    • bind

      private final String bind

    • secure

      private final boolean secure

    • submission

      private final boolean submission

    • config

      private final ListenerConfig config

  • Constructor Details

    • SmtpListener

      public SmtpListener(int port, String bind, ListenerConfig config, boolean secure, boolean submission)
      Constructs a new SmtpListener instance with the specified configuration.
      Parameters:
      port - The port number to listen on.
      bind - The network interface address to bind to.
      config - The ListenerConfig containing listener-specific settings.
      secure - true if the listener should handle secure (TLS) connections.
      submission - true if the listener is for mail submission (MSA).

  • Method Details

    • listen

      public void listen()
      Starts the listener.

      This method opens the server socket and enters a loop to accept incoming connections. Each new connection is passed to the thread pool for processing.

    • acceptConnection

      private void acceptConnection()
      Accepts incoming connections in a loop until a shutdown is initiated. For each connection, it submits a new EmailReceipt task to the thread pool. Connections from blocked IP addresses are immediately rejected.

    • serverShutdown

      public void serverShutdown() throws IOException
      Initiates a graceful shutdown of the listener.

      This method gracefully shuts down the listener by closing the server socket and terminating the thread pool.

      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs when closing the socket.

    • getListener

      public ServerSocket getListener()
      Gets the underlying ServerSocket instance.
      Returns:
      The ServerSocket instance.

    • getPort

      public int getPort()
      Gets the port number this listener is configured to use.
      Returns:
      The port number.

    • getActiveThreads

      public int getActiveThreads()
      Gets the number of currently active threads in this listener's thread pool.
      Returns:
      The number of active threads.

    • getCorePoolSize

      public int getCorePoolSize()
      Gets the core number of threads for the thread pool.
      Returns:
      The core pool size.

    • getMaximumPoolSize

      public int getMaximumPoolSize()
      Gets the maximum allowed number of threads for the thread pool.
      Returns:
      The maximum pool size.

    • getPoolSize

      public int getPoolSize()
      Gets the current number of threads in the pool.
      Returns:
      The current pool size.

    • getLargestPoolSize

      public int getLargestPoolSize()
      Gets the largest number of threads that have ever simultaneously been in the pool.
      Returns:
      The largest pool size reached.

    • getQueueSize

      public int getQueueSize()
      Gets the current size of the task queue. For a SynchronousQueue, this will always be 0.
      Returns:
      The number of tasks in the queue.

    • getCompletedTaskCount

      public long getCompletedTaskCount()
      Gets the approximate total number of tasks that have completed execution.
      Returns:
      The completed task count.

    • getTaskCount

      public long getTaskCount()
      Gets the approximate total number of tasks that have ever been scheduled for execution.
      Returns:
      The total task count.

    • getKeepAliveSeconds

      public long getKeepAliveSeconds()
      Gets the keep-alive time for idle threads in seconds.
      Returns:
      The thread keep-alive time in seconds.
